entry_fee: For Indian nationals approx ₹15-25; for foreign nationals approx ₹100 WanderOn
best_time: June to September (summer season for accessibility & pleasant weather); also shoulder months like May / October when possible Beyond Wild Places+1
nearest_railway: Nearest railway is far, likely Jammu Tawi or Srinagar (~ several hundred km). Not documented precise.
nearest_bus: Leh Bus Stand — within Leh town (< 5 km) — exact distance depends on starting point. Not documented exact.
nearest_airport: Kushok Bakula Rimpochee Airport, Leh — approx 5 km from Leh town center Wikipedia+1
accessibility: Located on a hill (Namgyal hill) overlooking Leh; uphill roads or walk from town; steep paths inside. Not fully wheelchair-friendly. Snow in winter may block access.
guided_tours: Local guides / heritage walk operators include Leh Palace; audio guide sometimes available; not always official. Not documented full details.
parking: Some parking near base; small local parking lots; Not documented charges.
nearby_amenities: In Leh town: hotels, cafés, shops, markets. Within walking/driving distance of Leh Bazaar, restaurants.
special_notes: Built in 17th century by Singey Namgyal; nine-storey grand structure; used for royal family residence; now partly ruined; offers panoramic views; close to other attractions like Shanti Stupa, Namgyal Tsemo, etc.
